description: '''Zeuhl''' (pronounced [zœl]; {{lit|celestial}}) is a [[music genre]] that is a hybrid of [[jazz fusion]], [[progressive rock|symphonic rock]] and [[Neoclassicism (music)|neoclassical music]], established in 1969 by the French band [[Magma (band)|Magma]]. The term comes from Kobaïan, the fictional language created by Magma's [[Christian Vander (musician)|Christian Vander]] and Klaus Blasquiz for Magma, in which ''Zeuhl Ẁortz'' means approximately {{gloss|celestial force}}.
